channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israeli airstrike on a Palestinian refugee camp in Lebanon kills 13 people
item.description: An Israeli airstrike on a Palestinian refugee camp in southern Lebanon on Tuesday killed 13 people and wounded several others, state media and government officials said.
item.content:encoded:
An Israeli airstrike on a Palestinian refugee camp in southern Lebanon on Tuesday killed 13 people and wounded several others, state media and government officials said.

(Image credit: Mohammad Zaatari)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: U.S. and Saudi Arabia discuss security and investments in White House visit
item.description: Prince Mohammed bin Salman Al Saud is visiting the White House. Greeted with military planes and a procession, he and Trump were friendly with each other as they spoke to reporters in the Oval Office.
item.content:encoded: Prince Mohammed bin Salman Al Saud is visiting the White House. Greeted with military planes and a procession, he and Trump were friendly with each other as they spoke to reporters in the Oval Office.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Trump defends Saudi crown prince over question about killing of Khashoggi
item.description: President Trump lashed out a reporter in the Oval Office who was asking about allegations the crown prince orchestrated the killing of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump lashed out a reporter in the Oval Office who was asking about allegations the crown prince orchestrated the killing of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Saige Miller

item.title: Saudi leader to discuss these deals with Trump. And, House votes on Epstein files today
item.description: President Trump welcomes Saudi Arabia's crown prince to the White House to discuss trade and security deals. And, the House votes today on whether to force the release of long-awaited Epstein files.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump welcomes Saudi Arabia's crown prince to the White House to discuss trade and security deals. And, the House votes today on whether to force the release of long-awaited Epstein files.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Britain unveils plan to overhaul its asylum system
item.description: Britain's government announced plans Monday to overhaul its asylum laws. Among the changes: making refugee status temporary and seizing high-value assets from asylum seekers.
item.content:encoded: Britain's government announced plans Monday to overhaul its asylum laws. Among the changes: making refugee status temporary and seizing high-value assets from asylum seekers.
item.dc:creator: Fatima Al-Kassab

item.title: Trump's White House hosts Saudi Crown Prince with big deals being inked
item.description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will visit the White House Tuesday, his first since the 2018 killing of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi by Saudi agents.
item.content:encoded:
Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will visit the White House Tuesday, his first since the 2018 killing of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi by Saudi agents.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: UN Security Council approves international peacekeeping force for Gaza
item.description: The United Nations Security Council has endorsed a U.S.-backed peace plan for Gaza, authorizing a temporary international force to help stabilize the enclave after two years of war.
item.content:encoded: The United Nations Security Council has endorsed a U.S.-backed peace plan for Gaza, authorizing a temporary international force to help stabilize the enclave after two years of war.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: The U.N. Security Council approves a U.S. plan for a Gaza stabilization force
item.description: The plan authorizes a security force in the devastated territory and envisions a possible path to an independent Palestinian state. Russia, which had circulated a rival resolution, abstained along with China on the 13-0 vote.
item.content:encoded:
The plan authorizes a security force in the devastated territory and envisions a possible path to an independent Palestinian state. Russia, which had circulated a rival resolution, abstained along with China on the 13-0 vote.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Part of the U.S. strategy in 20 years of war in Afghanistan? Weakening poppies
item.description: In an exclusive Washington Post story, reporter Warren Strobel describes a CIA operation in Afghanistan over the course of about a decade. The goal was to degrade the country's opium crop.
item.content:encoded: In an exclusive Washington Post story, reporter Warren Strobel describes a CIA operation in Afghanistan over the course of about a decade. The goal was to degrade the country's opium crop.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ofman

item.title: Saudi Crown Prince visits Trump in the White House
item.description: Saudi Arabia's crown prince visits Trump to firm up bilateral and personal ties
item.content:encoded: Saudi Arabia's crown prince visits Trump to firm up bilateral and personal ties
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy
